With each order to silence potential witnesses, it moves our body closer to a breaking point. For the sake of our nation, I pray the Pres. reverses his course of stonewalling Congress & complies with congressional subpoenas in order to prevent a burgeoning constitutional crisis.
It is our constitutional duty to provide oversight of the Executive Branch, and I will continue to uphold the oath I swore when coming to Congress.

That said, I, along with the majority of my Democratic colleagues, have resisted the growing calls for Presidential impeachment in order to secure documents and testimony that would allow us to determine whether or not the President committed high crimes or misdemeanors.
I‚Äôve said it before, and I will say it now: Robert Mueller needs to testify publicly.

I understand his reticence to perform in the likely political circus that will come with his public testimony, but this matter is too important to our democracy and to the constituents I represent to forgo his public testimony.

I want to thank him for his statement today, however, there are still many questions that remain unanswered and are critical to understanding the Special Counsel‚Äôs determinations on several matters within the investigation.
I have the utmost respect for Special Counsel Robert Mueller, his service to our country, and his dedication to the rule of law.

Fast and rising water is eroding and putting immense pressure on levees protecting homesteads and farm land. The Grand Pass levees hold the MO river back from 10,000 acres. 5,000 of those acres are currently unplantable due to water seepage. @MissouriLevees @KC_USACE @USACEHQ
